anti_bad_rules.description_en: I cannot stand worlds where sloppy, unfair or incoherent rules quietly destroy people’s lives or the potential of a country. If a system hurts people not because of necessity but because of bad design, I feel an urge to redesign it from the ground up.
typical_triggers_en: Unclear responsibility in AI or government decisions
People being punished or excluded because of opaque processes
Institutions running on vibes and hierarchy instead of transparent criteria

structure_hacking.description_en: I feel genuine enjoyment when I can take something messy, vague or emotional and turn it into a clear structure: definitions, layers, protocols, proofs. Hacking the world through concepts, evidence and protocols is intrinsically fun to me.
typical_triggers_en: Turning a vague problem into a clean 3–4 layer model
Designing protocols that make cheating or lying structurally difficult
Seeing people suddenly understand a complex idea because of a better structure

protect_people.description_en: I want the people who trusted me or crossed paths with me to stand on better rules, not be sacrificed by stupid systems. If someone close to me is harmed by a rigged game, I feel personally responsible for not having changed the rules early enough.
typical_triggers_en: Friends being blocked by unfair school or job systems
Talent wasted because the environment is badly designed
Seeing people around me accept 'that’s just how it is' when it is clearly a design failure

cosmic_game.description_en: If I am going to live only once in this universe, I want to treat civilization itself as a long game and try to move its rules, not just survive inside them. I am attracted to moves that still make sense when you look from the year 2060, 2100 or even 3000.
typical_triggers_en: Questions about AGI/ASI, long-term governance and multi-century effects
Designing systems that could still be audited or understood hundreds of years later
Thinking about how today’s decisions will look from very far future perspectives

free_will_resolution.description_en: On a 0–1 scale, I estimate that about 0.7 of my behavior can be consciously steered by inspecting and editing my own narratives and meta-choices. Biology and past experience still matter, but I actively try to rewrite parts of my story instead of treating them as fixed.
free_will_resolution.notes_en: I explicitly accept the idea that 'free will' is not binary but a question of resolution: how clearly I can see and adjust the values and stories that drive me.

life_check_question_en: Which gaps would I still be proud to care about when I look back at my life right before death?
notes_en: This file is Hinata Owner Driver Profile v0.1. Future experiences and perspective shifts will be reflected in v0.2, v0.3, etc., rather than silently overwriting this snapshot.
